fake_data.helpTip: If ‘true’, fake EEG data will be used instead of real EEG data. Useful for testing by software development team.

acq_device.helpTip: Specifies the hardware used for EEG data collection.

acq_connection_method.helpTip: Specifies the method used to connect to the data acquisition device (LSL or TCP). Default: LSL

acq_host.helpTip: Specifies the host for a TCP connection (used when Acquisition Connection Method is set to 'TCP'). Default: 127.0.0.1

acq_port.helpTip: Specifies the port for a TCP connection (used when Acquisition Connection Method is set to ‘TCP’). Default: 9000

trigger_type.helpTip: Specifies whether to use a picture or auditory stimulus to calibrate trigger latency. Default: text

static_trigger_offset.helpTip: Specifies the static trigger offset (in seconds) used to align triggers properly with EEG data from LSL. The system includes built-in offset correction, but there is still a hardware-limited offset between EEG and trigger timing values for which the system does not account. The default value of 0.1 has been verified for OHSU hardware. The correct value may be different for other computers, and must be determined on a case-by-case basis. Default: .1

k_folds.helpTip: Specifies the number of folds used for cross-validation when calculating AUC. Default: 10

trial_length.helpTip: Specifies the length (in seconds) of the EEG data collection window after each stimulus presentation. Default: 0.5

prestim_length.helpTip: Specifies the length (in seconds) of the EEG data window to return before inquiry presentation. Default: 1

alert_sound_file.helpTip: Specifies the path to an audio file to be played as an alert tone when experiments or offline analysis is complete. Default: bcipy/static/sounds/beep.wav

signal_model_path.helpTip: Directory of the pre-trained signal model. This is often the the calibration session directory.

filter_high.helpTip: Specifies the frequency bound (in Hz) of the low-pass filter (high cutoff). Default: 20

filter_low.helpTip: Specifies the frequency bound (in Hz) of the high-pass filter (low cutoff). Default: 1

filter_order.helpTip: Specifies the slope of the low-pass and high-pass filters. Default: 2

notch_filter_frequency.helpTip: Specifies the frequency (in Hz) of the notch filter used to remove electrical artifact from the surrounding environment. Default: 60

down_sampling_rate.helpTip: Specifies the decimation factor (integer only) for downsampling of EEG data. Default: 2

artifact_rejection.helpTip: If ‘true’, the system will detect and reject inquiries containing unwanted artifacts (e.g. blinks). This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

high_voltage_threshold.helpTip: If ‘true’, an upper voltage threshold will be set for artifact rejection. Detection of values above the specified threshold will trigger rejection of a inquiry. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

high_voltage_value.helpTip: Specifies the high voltage threshold (in microvolts) for artifact rejection (High Voltage Threshold must be set to ‘true’). Default: 75E+6. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

low_voltage_threshold.helpTip: If ‘true’, a lower voltage threshold will be set for artifact rejection. Detection of values below the specified threshold will trigger rejection of a inquiry. This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

low_voltage_value.helpTip: Specifies the low voltage threshold (in microvolts) for artifact rejection (Low Voltage Threshold must be set to ‘true’). Default: -75E-6 This is not implemented in the current version of the system.

summarize_session.helpTip: If 'true', writes an Excel file which summarizes the session data by charting evidence per inquiry.

parameter_location.helpTip: Specifies the file containing the current system parameters. Default: bcipy/parameters/parameters.json

data_save_loc.helpTip: Specifies the location in which to save data files after each recording. This must be a directory ending with /. Default: data/

full_screen.helpTip: If ‘true’, the task will be displayed in full screen mode. If ‘false’, the task will be displayed in a window.

window_height.helpTip: Specifies the height (in norm units) of the task window when not in full screen mode (Full Screen Mode On/Off must be set to ‘false’). See https://www.psychopy.org/general/units.html. Default: 500

window_width.helpTip: Specifies the width (in norm units) of the task window when not in full screen mode (Full Screen Mode On/Off must be set to ‘false’). See https://www.psychopy.org/general/units.html. Default: 500

acq_show_viewer.helpTip: If ‘true’, the EEG signal viewer will be displayed.

stim_screen.helpTip: Specifies which monitor to use for task display when two monitors are in use. If ‘0’, the task will be displayed on the primary monitor (with the EEG signal viewer on the second monitor, if EEG Viewer On/Off is set to ‘true’). If ‘1’, the opposite monitor assignment will be used.

task_buffer_length.helpTip: Specifies the delay time (in seconds) between the final stimulus in one inquiry and the beginning (target stimulus or fixation cross) of the next inquiry in a task. Default: 2

is_txt_stim.helpTip: If ‘true’, text stimuli will be used. If ‘false’, image stimuli will be loaded from the folder specified in Image Stimulus Folder.

path_to_presentation_images.helpTip: Specifies the location of image files to be used as stimuli (Text Stimuli On/Off must be set to ‘false’). This must be a directory ending with /.

stim_space_char.helpTip: Specifies the text or Unicode character which represents a space during text-stimuli tasks. Default: –

stim_order.helpTip: Specifies the ordering of stimuli in an inquiry. Default is random.

target_positions.helpTip: Specifies the positions of target stimuli in calibration task. Default is random.

nontarget_inquiries.helpTip: Specifies the percentage (0-100) of inquiries which target stimuli flashed is not in inquiry. Default is 10 percent.

stim_length.helpTip: Specifies the number of stimuli to present in each inquiry. Default: 10

time_flash.helpTip: Specifies the duration of time (in seconds) that each stimulus is displayed in an inquiry.

time_prompt.helpTip: The amount of time in seconds to present the target stimuli prompt in an inquiry.

time_fixation.helpTip: The amount of time in seconds to present the fixation stimuli in an inquiry.

stim_jitter.helpTip: Specifies the time (sec) to jitter presentation rates. Default: 0.0

stim_pos_x.helpTip: Specifies the center point of the stimulus position along the X axis. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: 0

stim_pos_y.helpTip: Specifies the center point of the stimulus position along the Y axis. Possible values range from -1 to 1, with 0 representing the center. Default: 0

font.helpTip: Specifies the font used for all text stimuli. Default: Consolas

stim_height.helpTip: Specifies the height of text stimuli. See https://www.psychopy.org/general/units.html. Default: 0.5

stim_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of text stimuli within the RSVP stream. Default: white

target_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of target characters during calibration. Default: white

fixation_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of the fixation cross that appears before each inquiry. Default: red

background_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of the task background. Default: black

info_height.helpTip: Specifies the height of info text stimuli. See https://www.psychopy.org/general/units.html. Default: 0.1

task_text.helpTip: Specifies the target phrase displayed at the top of the screen during text-stimuli copy/spelling tasks.

task_height.helpTip: Specifies the height of task-specific text, e.g. #/100 in calibration and target phrase in copy/spelling. See https://www.psychopy.org/general/units.html. Default: 0.1

task_color.helpTip: Specifies the color of task-specific text, e.g. #/100 in calibration and target phrase in copy/spelling. Default: white

stim_number.helpTip: Specifies the number of inquiries to present in a calibration session. Default: 100

enable_breaks.helpTip: If ‘true’, automatic breaks will be added to the calibration session. If ‘false’, automatic breaks will not occur, but the session can still be paused by pressing Space.

break_len.helpTip: Specifies the length (in seconds) of automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

trials_before_break.helpTip: Specifies the number of inquiries between automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

break_message.helpTip: Specifies the message displayed during automatic calibration breaks (Automatic Calibration Breaks On/Off must be set to ‘true’).

min_inq_len.helpTip: The minimum number of inquiries to present in spelling tasks

max_inq_len.helpTip: Specifies the maximum number of inquiries to present in copy/spelling tasks. The task will end if this number is reached.

max_minutes.helpTip: Specifies the time limit (in minutes) for copy/spelling tasks. The task will end if this time limit is reached.

max_selections.helpTip: The maximum number of selections for copy/spelling tasks. The task will end if this number is reached.

decision_threshold.helpTip: Specifies the decision threshold for stimulus selection in copy/spelling class. If the posterior probability (combining EEG and language model evidence) for a stimulus reaches this threshold, it will be selected. Possible value range: 0.0-1.0. Default: 0.8

min_inq_per_series.helpTip: Specifies the minimum number of inquiries to present before making a decision in copy/spelling tasks. Default: 1

max_inq_per_series.helpTip: Specifies the maximum number of inquiries to present before making a decision in copy/spelling tasks.

backspace_always_shown.helpTip: If ‘true’, the backspace character will be included in every inquiry in text-stimuli copy/spelling tasks. If ‘false’, the backspace character will be treated the same as other characters, appearing in inquiries only when warranted by EEG/language model evidence.

spelled_letters_count.helpTip: Specifies the number of letters in the target phrase that are already typed when the task begins, e.g. if the target phrase is “THE_DOG”, setting this parameter to ‘4’ would display “THE_” as the typed string, and the user would begin typing with D. If ‘0’, the typed string will be blank.

lang_model_type.helpTip: Specifies which language model to use. Default: UNIFORM

lm_backspace_prob.helpTip: Specifies the initial probability assigned to the backspace character in the language model. Possible value range: 0.0-1.0. Default: 0.05

show_preview_inquiry.helpTip: If ‘true’, the inquiry will be previewed as applicable for the task. *Note* Not all tasks will have this enabled!

preview_inquiry_progress_method.helpTip: If show_preview_inquiry true, this will determine how to proceed after a key hit. 0 = preview only; 1 = press to confirm; 2 = press to skip to another inquiry

preview_inquiry_length.helpTip: Length of time in seconds to present an inquiry preview to the user.

preview_inquiry_key_input.readableName: Preview Inquiry Display Key Input Method
preview_inquiry_key_input.helpTip: Defines the key used to engage with inquiry preview.

preview_inquiry_isi.helpTip: The time between previewing an inquiry and the start of an inquiry.

show_feedback.helpTip: If ‘true’, feedback will be shown after each inquiry.

feedback_duration.helpTip: Specifies the length in time (seconds) feedback will be displayed after each inquiry in registered tasks (ex. RSVP Copy Phrase). Default: 2

psd_method.helpTip: Specifies the method used to approximate power spectral density bands (Welch or MultiTaper). Default: Welch
